byline.contributor: Lilia Blaise and Martin de Bourmont contributed reporting.
byline.original: By ALISSA J. RUBIN and ADAM NOSSITER

abstract: Many French citizens are questioning whether killing of Roman Catholic priest Jacques Hamel in Normandy, by teenager who was well known to counterterrorism authorities, could have been prevented.
lead_paragraph: Adel Kermiche, 19, had spent nearly 10 months in detention but was released in March over prosecutors’ objections.

headline.main: French Ask Whether Priest’s Killer, Listed as a Threat, Could Have Been Stopped
headline.print_headline: French Ask Why Priest’s Killer, Listed as a Threat, Was Able to Strike

snippet: Adel Kermiche, 19, had spent nearly 10 months in detention but was released in March over prosecutors’ objections....

keywords.value: Islamic State in Iraq and Syria (ISIS)
keywords.name: organizations
